function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Mandating the use of low-cost SOFTs for remote surveillance of travelers and susceptible populations could lead to privacy concerns and data security risks.","Impact":"Increased risk of privacy breaches and unauthorized access to sensitive health data.","Mitigation":"Implement strict data encryption and access control measures, conduct regular security audits, and provide clear guidelines on data usage and protection.","Technologies":"Data encryption technologies, access control systems, secure data transfer protocols.","People":"Travelers, unvaccinated individuals, healthcare workers, and employees required to wear SOFTs.","Owner":"Healthcare regulators, data security professionals, and technology providers."},{"Description":"Inaccurate performance and lack of validation standards for SOFTs can lead to false detection alerts and misdiagnosis, compromising public trust in the technology.","Impact":"Loss of confidence in SOFTs, inappropriate quarantine measures, and delayed proper medical intervention.","Mitigation":"Establish comprehensive validation standards, conduct independent testing, and educate users about the limitations of SOFTs.","Technologies":"Validation frameworks, independent testing protocols, user education resources.","People":"Users of SOFTs, healthcare professionals, and policymakers.","Owner":"Health technology assessment organizations, public health agencies, and SOFT manufacturers."},{"Description":"Reliance on wearable technology for early detection of COVID-19 without clinical reliability may lead to complacency and lack of adherence to other preventive measures.","Impact":"Reduced vigilance in following non-technological preventive measures, such as mask-wearing and physical distancing.","Mitigation":"Provide clear guidance on the complementary role of SOFTs and traditional preventive measures, and promote holistic risk mitigation strategies.","Technologies":"Educational resources, communication platforms, public health campaigns.","People":"General population, SOFT users, and healthcare providers.","Owner":"Public health agencies, community leaders, and communication experts."}]}
